import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
B10_SEC = pd.read_csv("Downloads/B10_SEC_cleaned.csv")
B10_SEC
# just get big ten east for now 
# predict on 2019 so create new df of that 
# create machine learning model on rest
B10_SEC['Year'].unique()

B10_E = ['Big Ten East']
B10_E = B10_SEC[B10_SEC['Conference Division'].isin(B10_E)] 
B10_E = B10_E.reset_index(drop = True)
B10_E.head()
np.random.seed(42)

source:
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.model_selection import StratifiedShuffleSplit

# used stratified split to make sure all teams were in both
split = StratifiedShuffleSplit(n_splits=7, test_size=0.25, random_state=42)
for train_index, test_index in split.split(B10_E, B10_E["Team"]):
    strat_train_set = B10_E.loc[train_index]
    strat_test_set = B10_E.loc[test_index]
strat_train_set

y = pd.DataFrame(strat_train_set.Ranking)
# 'Ranking', took out ranking 
high_corr = [ 
 'Win',
 'Loss',
 'Total_Points',
 'Touchdowns',
 'Off_TDs',
 'PAT',
 'Pass_Yards_Attempt',
 'Opp_Pass_Attempts',
 'Scoring_Off_Rank',
 'Redzone_Scores',
 'Rushing_Def_Rank',
 'Rush_Attempts',
 'Opp_First_Down_Passes',
 'First_Down_Passes',
 'Yards_Completion',
 'Off_Plays',
 'Redzone_Attempts',
 'Avg_Points_per_Game_Allowed',
 'X3rd_Down_Def_Rank',
 'Off_Yards']

X = strat_train_set[high_corr]
numeric_attribs = list(X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]))
len(numeric_attribs)
len(high_corr)

import statsmodels.api as sm
import statsmodels.formula.api as smf
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

full_pipeline = ColumnTransformer([
        ("num_xform", StandardScaler(), numeric_attribs),
    ])
full_pipeline
B10_E_prepared = full_pipeline.fit_transform(strat_train_set)
B10_E_prepared
lm= LinearRegression()
lm.fit(B10_E_prepared, y)

from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
B10_E_predictions = lm.predict(B10_E_prepared)
lin_mse = mean_squared_error(y, B10_E_predictions)
lin_rmse = np.sqrt(lin_mse)
lin_rmse

test_y = pd.DataFrame(strat_test_set.Ranking)
test_X = strat_test_set[high_corr]
# test_numeric_attribs = list(test_X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]))
# test_numeric_attribs
test_prepared = full_pipeline.fit_transform(strat_test_set)
test_prepared
test_predictions = lm.predict(test_prepared)
lin_mse = mean_squared_error(test_y, test_predictions)
lin_rmse = np.sqrt(lin_mse)
lin_rmse
# this percentage (rmse) tells us how wrong the model will be

  return f(*args, **kwargs)

source:
logreg = LogisticRegression()
logreg.fit(B10_E_prepared, y)

Y_pred = logreg.predict(test_prepared)

acc_log = round(logreg.score(B10_E_prepared, y) * 100, 2)
acc_log
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeClassifier

dec_tree = DecisionTreeClassifier(max_depth=5)
dec_tree.fit(B10_E_prepared, y)

Y_prediction = dec_tree.predict(test_prepared)

dec_tree.score(B10_E_prepared, y)
acc_dec_tree = round(dec_tree.score(B10_E_prepared, y) * 100, 2)
acc_dec_tree

B10_east = ['Indiana', 'Maryland', 'Michigan', 'Michigan St.', 'Ohio St.',
       'Penn St.', 'Rutgers']
df_2020 = df_2020[df_2020['Team'].isin(B10_east)] 
df_2020['Team'] = df_2020['Team'].str.strip()
df_2020.columns = df_2020.columns.str.replace(".", "_")


df_2020

df_2020_copy = df_2020.drop(['Team'], axis = 1)
df_2020_copy = df_2020_copy[['Win','Loss',
 'Total_Points',
 'Touchdowns',
 'Off_TDs',
 'PAT',
 'Pass_Yards_Attempt',
 'Opp_Pass_Attempts',
 'Scoring_Off_Rank',
 'Redzone_Scores',
 'Rushing_Def_Rank',
 'Rush_Attempts',
 'Opp_First_Down_Passes',
 'First_Down_Passes',
 'Yards_Completion',
 'Off_Plays',
 'Redzone_Attempts',
 'Avg_Points_per_Game_Allowed',
 'X3rd_Down_Def_Rank',
 'Off_Yards']]
df_2020_prepared = full_pipeline.fit_transform(df_2020_copy)
